planet_description.name: Short Description
planet_description.value: Uranus is the third largest of the Solar System's gas giants. It is the coldest planet in the Solar System.

discovery.title: Discovery
discovery.text: Uranus was the first to be discovered by the use of the modern telescope, with its discovery credited to the English astronomer William Herschel in 1781.

axial_tilt.title: Axial Tilt
axial_tilt.text: Uranus has an axial tilt of 97.77°, meaning it effectively rolls around the Sun "on its side" compared to the other planets in the Solar System.

observation.title: Observation
observation.text: While in Opposition (from the Sun, relative to the Earth), Uranus becomes visible to the naked-eye. It would appear as a faint star under dark sky conditions.

general_structure.title: General Structure
general_structure.text: Uranus' cyan color is due to the absorption of red light by atmospheric methane.

atmosphere.title: Atmosphere
atmosphere.text: The gaseous atmosphere gradually transitions into the internal liquid layers.

mantle_composition.title: Mantle
mantle_composition.text: The ice mantle is not in fact composed of ice in the conventional sense, but of a hot and dense fluid, also called a water-ammonia ocean.

mantle_magnetic_field.title: Mantle Magnetic Field
mantle_magnetic_field.text: A relatively large magnetic field is generated by convection currents at shallow depths within the planet.
